intro: Bidens eatonii var. interstes, commonly known as the narrowleaf beggarlice, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as fields and woodland edges. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture, while its flowers are clustered in small groups. It is a perennial herb that produces seeds that are dispersed by wind, contributing to its spread in suitable environments.
